properties.areaDesc: Grand Marais to Whitefish Point MI
properties.headline: Gale Watch issued January 8 at 4:48AM EST until January 9 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Marquette MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Heavy Freezing Spray Warning, heavy freezing
spray at a rate of 2 cm per hour or greater occurring, and may
rapidly accumulate on vessels. For the Gale Warning, north
winds 20 to 25 kt with gusts up to 35 kt and waves 8 to 10
feet occurring. For the Small Craft Advisory, north winds 15
to 25 kt with gusts up to 30 kt and waves 6 to 9 feet
expected. For the Gale Watch, southeast winds 20 to 30 kt with
gusts up to 45 kt and waves 3 to 6 feet possible.

* WHERE...Grand Marais to Whitefish Point MI.

* WHEN...For the Heavy Freezing Spray Warning, until 10 AM EST
this morning. For the Gale Warning, until 9 AM EST this
morning. For the Small Craft Advisory, from 9 AM this morning
to 7 PM EST this evening. For the Gale Watch, from late
tonight through Thursday evening.

* IMPACTS...Operating a vessel in heavy freezing spray is
hazardous. Freezing spray may render mechanical and electronic
components inoperative. Rapid ice accretion on decks and
superstructures may result in a catastrophic loss of
stability. Strong winds will cause hazardous waves which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should prepare for dangerous accumulation of ice on
their vessel. If possible, remain in port, avoid the warning area
or conduct mitigation.

Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: GALE WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...HEAVY FREEZING SPRAY WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...GALE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING
